title: Carer's Allowance
tagline: Carerâ€™s Allowance is a benefit to help people who care for a disabled person for 35 hours or more each week. The person who's cared for must be in receipt of a qualifying benefit, eg Personal Independence Payment, Disability Living Allowance at the middle or highest rate or Armed Forces Independence Payment.

modules.title: Real-time usage
modules.description: Live number of users on any page within the service
info: Shows the estimated number of users currently accessing the service on GOV.UK.

modules.title: Digital take-up
modules.description: Users completing the transaction online, including assisted digital users

modules.title: Completion rate
info: Data source: Google Analytics (unique visitor numbers based on sampled data)
Completion rate measures the proportion of people who started a claim and were able to complete it.
It is calculated as percentage of unique visitors who arrived at the final page of the service out of those who arrived at the start page.

modules.title: Users at each stage
modules.description: Number of users who completed important stages of the transaction last week
info: Data source: Google Analytics (unique visitor numbers based on sampled data)
The total number of unique users who arrived at each stage.

modules.title: Service availability
info: Page load time measures the time taken for a sample page within the service to load.
Uptime measures the percentage of time that the service was observed to be available.
